page.title: 07Woolstaston
page.content: This is a picturesque hamlet with several fine old houses and a 13th Century church.One of the oldest buildings is a black & white cruck house dating from circa 1450.There are a few modern houses on the fringe of the hamlet. The residents of the village are mostly connected with farming but there are a few families of newcomers who work elsewhere.One attractive farm house manages to combine a thriving Bed & Breakfast business with a working farm.The Village Hall was built in 1860 and had fallen into dis- use by the end of World War II. Owner- ship by the Bishop of Hereford has now been established and consideration is being given to its possible future use The residents of Woolstaston have a strong sense of identity and a close community spirit.
